intro: Sphaeralcea rusbyi var. eremicola, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape, with numerous small, yellow flowers clustered at the top of the plant. The species thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating high drought tolerance. Its leaves are typically small, hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern to reduce water loss. The plant plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
